description: The Wix Dashboard API allows the code in [dashboard pages](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-working-with-dashboard-pages) to interact with the Wix dashboard enviroment.
Using the module you can:
- Navigate users to other pages in the dashboard.
- Display modals and toasts.
- Retrieve state data about the dashboard and use it to customize your page.
To use the Wix Dashboard API, import the applicable function from `wix-dashboard`:
```js
import { <name-of-function> } from 'wix-dashboard';
## Before you begin
It's important to note that the Wix Dashboard API is only available in dashboard pages. The functions in this API won't work in any other code files on your site.

params.name: closeData
params.doc: Data to pass to the modal's opener. This data is returned by [`openModal`](#openmodal) once the modal is closed. Should not contain any functions as values.

params.name: pageId
params.doc: ID of the page to navigate to.

description: Navigates the user to another page in the dashboard.
If an invalid pageId value is passed to this function, a "Page Not Found" message is displayed in the dashboard.

examples.title: Navigate to the dashboard home page

params.name: observer
params.doc:
Callback function for receiving state data. 

Receives 2 parameters, `state` and `envData`.

description: Receives changes to the state of the page surrounding a dashboard component. You can use this data to dynamically update a dashboard component's content.
The callback function passed to `observeState` is triggered when the dashboard component is initialized and every time the page is updated.
The callback function should define the following parameters:
* `state`: For receiving state data.
* `envData`: For receiving general data about the user's current environment.
The format of the `state` argument received by `observeState` depends on the page that hosts the dashboard component.

examples.title: Receive state data and log it to the console

params.name: componentId
params.doc: ID of the component to show in the modal.

params.name: componentParams
params.doc: Custom data to pass into the component.

description: This function returns a promise that resolves when the modal is closed.
The object that the promise resolves to contains any data passed to the [`closeModal`](#closeModal) function used to close the modal.

examples.title: Open a modal and log the data returned when it's closed
body: console.log('The modal was closed and returned:', closeData);

description: Use the `config` parameter to:
* Control the toast's appearance.
* Set callback functions to run when the user sees or clicks on the toast.
* Create a clickable call-to-action that displays in the toast.
Requests to display toasts may be queued and the toast may not be displayed immediately.
The object returned by `shotToast` contains a function that can be used to remove the toast.

> **Note:** When the timeout parameter is set to `none` the toast is rendered into the page layout and pushes the rest of the page down. When timeout is set to `normal`, the toast appears on top of other content on the page.

examples.title: Display a success toast when a product is updated
Display an error toast with a 'Learn more' link
Remove a displayed toast
body: // Display a toast and save the remove function.

members.name: text
members.doc: Text that appears in the call-to-action.

members.name: removeToastOnClick
members.doc: Whether to remove the toast after the call-to-action is clicked.

members.name: onClick
members.doc: Callback function to run after the call-to-action is clicked.

members.name: message
members.doc: Text that appears in the toast.

members.name: timeout
members.doc:
Whether the toast removes itself or not. 

Options: `none`, `normal`.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Toast color and message type. 

Options: 
- `standard`: Blue toast. 
- `success`: Green toast.  
- `warning`: Yellow warning toast.
- `error`: Red error toast.

members.name: priority
members.doc:
Priority of the toast. If several toasts are triggered at the same time, they're displayed in the order of their priority levels. 
Options: `low`, `normal`, `high`.

members.name: action
members.doc: Object representing a call-to-action that is displayed in the toast.

members.name: onCloseClick
members.doc: Callback function to run when the toast is closed by clicking its close button.

members.name: onToastSeen
members.doc: Callback function to run when the toast is seen by the user.
